Clause: subject="RE: Merged Transport Layer Protocol Development"
Tls-draft was created specifically as a forum for the discussion of the Microsoft STLP strawman document.
The reason for this is that the STLP strawman document is not an official IETF document.
Win Treese, Microsoft and Netscape did not want this document to be confused in any way
with the actual spec that is being developed by the working group.
However, since the consensus of the emails is to discuss the STLP strawman document on ietf-tls,
you can find the STLP strawman document at:
Subject: Re: Merged Transport Layer Protocol Development
These points and others will be discussed in some detail on tls-draft@w3.org - as that is the alias for discussion of the STLP strawman document.
If you are not a member of that alias,
I would strongly encourage you to join and participate in the discussion.
w3.org with the word "subscribe" in the subject line.

but I am puzzled as to why there is now a second mailing list.

for one, I can't find any reference to any mail
